result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Hermes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed. The defendant must pay costs during the term of ES and probation. It is the Court's intention that costs NOT be taken out of inmate funds.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No controlled substances without prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must participate in community based counseling at least 3 times per week. If there is a sober living facility, the Court recommends DOC place the defendant there. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program if he is revoked and ES is converted to in custody time.

Sentencing hearing on March 20, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Daniel R Hermes in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Defendant Daniel R Hermes in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State indicates that the victim was notified via initial contact letter and the State received no response. The State indicates that she checked to see if the deft was in custody at the time of the initial contact but that was inconclusive. The State has reached out to the deft's attorney in his own felony case but the attorney has not responded to their inquiry. The State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt/waives reading of same; NG plea entered. Upon pl to Cts 1 & 4, Cts 2, 3 & 5 are DRI. On Ct 1, the State recommends WPS with ES left up to the Court and in Ct 4, the State recommends probation.
P-NC to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim, CD.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
